tweets.text:
Reminder for UK Water twitter: 10 days left to respond to the @EnvAgency consultation 'Updating the determination of water stressed areas in England'. 

(AKA: should metering be compulsory and if so where?)

https://t.co/240NXaIpGZ

Attention anglers, the new #FishingLicence images have launched! 

Get set to relax in nature. Buy your new fishing licence at: https://t.co/fx56eQlGOg https://t.co/4fHZRib9Z7
@PlanAbby @EnvAgency @TE2100Plan Congratulations! It's great to have work that's so interesting and so important. Glad you're leading it.

Can you help us in our fight against #WasteCrime? 

We've launched a Waste Crime Survey to help us build a better intelligence picture across the country. 

Your responses will be kept confidential and anonymous. 

Complete the survey here: https://t.co/THxMyWjzgX https://t.co/2s6TGQONnn

There seems to be oil leaking into the River Severn at Stourport on Severn @canalrivertrust @EnvAgency 

Smells quite bad and fresh! https://t.co/ya58Bhbdex

@PlanAbby @EnvAgency @TE2100Plan Congratulations Abby! We are at the beginning of constructing a similar plan for the Clyde and would value the chance to hear and learn from those involved in its processes.... Perhaps we could catch up when you've got your feet under the table a bit?

Breaking: @thameswater fined ¬£2.3m, with costs of nearly ¬£90,000 for ‚Äúentirely foreseeable‚Äù #pollution.

More than 1,100 fish died when equipment failures released sewage into 2 streams at Henley in 2016.

urls.title: Whinlatter Forest dam project to combat floods

tweets.text:
1/3 Countryside Team Update: Tree planting at Monkmoor. 
Our team has planted an amazing 2,780 trees on the Monkmoor River Ground so far this winter & will be planting a further 300 this week. This work has been funded by @ShrewsburyTC, @EnvAgency & the #ERDF https://t.co/dWTPVaO0Lv

urls.title: Car Park Owner Pledges Action After Meeting Held Over Flooding Concerns
urls.description: The owner of a car park in Market Harborough which floods during prolonged rainfall, has pledged to take action in a bid to stop cars getting submerged. It follows talks with Harborough District Council, the Environment Agency and Harborough MP Neil O'Brien, amid on-going concerns about the situa
